p: Results of the CCA showed dependencies between: (A) the content of elements in leaves (Ca, Mn, Cu, Fe, Pb), the location of the trees in parks or streets, and their health (Q); (B) pests and diseases occurring on the trees, the location of the trees in parks or streets, and their health (Q); (C) the content of elements in leaves (Mn, Fe, Cu, Pb, Ca, Zn), the perimeter of the trees, pests and diseases occurring on the trees and their health (Q) ( Fig 1). The strongest dependencies between the factors were found in Wroc≈Çaw; the content of Fe, Mn and Cu in the leaves had the most negative effect on the health of the black locust trees growing along the streets of this city ( Fig 1A). The remaining dependencies are discussed in the next parts of the paper.
